title: NWO-Talent Programme Vidi 2024
funding_amount: Up to €850,000 per project for a maximum duration of five years.
eligibility: Researchers with a PhD obtained between 1 October 2016 and 1 October 2024 (extensions possible for specific circumstances, e.g., parental leave, illness).
restrictions: Applicants may only submit one Vidi application per calendar year. A maximum of two Vidi submissions per applicant is allowed in their career.
unique_conditions: New pilot program prioritizes funding for female researchers rated as 'very good'.
financial_constraints: No double funding from NWO or other grants; co-funding cannot exceed 49% of total project costs.
eligible_costs: Personnel, consumables, small investments; data sharing and management costs.

title: NWO Open Technology Programme 2025
submission_period: 13 January 2025 to 12 December 2025, unless the grant ceiling of €25.9M is reached earlier.
funding_amount: Up to €950,000 per project (€1,050,000 for projects with an investment character).
eligibility: Researchers with tenured or tenure-track positions at Dutch universities, university medical centers, and affiliated research institutes, including KNAW and NWO institutes.
restrictions: Mandatory co-funding if total project costs exceed €700,000. Applications must comply with the National Knowledge Security Guidelines.
unique_conditions: User committee required with at least 4 users (2 non-academic); adherence to DORA principles.
financial_constraints: NWO funding cannot exceed 49% of total project costs if co-funding is provided. Co-funding of 25% is required for costs exceeding €700,000.
eligible_costs: Personnel, consumables, small investments, data management, and sharing costs.

title: NWO Open Competition Domain Science-M (2024-2025)
submission_period: 6 August 2024 to 31 July 2025 (14:00 CEST), except ENW-M-1-Weave proposals with FWO as partner agency, which are from 1 December 2024 to 28 February 2025 (14:00 CET).
funding_amount: Up to €400,000 for ENW-M-1 proposals, €800,000 for ENW-M-2 proposals, and €150,000 to €500,000 for investments under ENW-M-1X.
domains: Earth sciences, astronomy, chemistry, computer science, life sciences, physics, and mathematics.
eligibility: Full, associate, and assistant professors or equivalent researchers with tenured or tenure-track positions at Dutch universities, university medical centers, or affiliated institutes. Certain tenure-track researchers with guaranteed positions may also apply.
restrictions: Mandatory waiting period of 12 months before submitting a new ENW-M proposal if previously considered. ENW-M-1 and ENW-M-1X allow only one main applicant with no co-applicants. ENW-M-2 allows one co-applicant with complementary expertise.
unique_conditions: Mandatory co-funding of 25% for investments exceeding €150,000.
Bilateral collaborations allowed with Germany, Flanders, or Luxembourg under the Weave and LUX principles.
Preferential treatment available for starting researchers within the first two years of their career.
financial_constraints: NWO funding cannot exceed 49% of total project costs for modules like Money follows Cooperation.
eligible_costs: Personnel (PhD, postdoc, non-scientific staff).
Material costs (€15,000 per year per FTE).
Investments (€150,000 to €500,000).
Knowledge utilization (€25,000).
Internationalization (€25,000).
call_document: docs/Call for proposals OC ENW-M ronde 24-25_EN_nov2024.pdf

title: NWO SSH Open Competition M 2024
domains: Social Sciences and Humanities (SSH), encompassing disciplines such as sociology, psychology, economics, history, and cultural studies.
eligibility: Researchers who obtained their PhD at least ten years prior to the application deadline, holding a salaried position at a Dutch knowledge institution.
restrictions: Applicants with an ongoing SSH Open Competition project may only submit a proposal if the planned end date of the current project is within one year of the deadline of this call.
unique_conditions: Each application may include one co-applicant, without restrictions on the number of years since their PhD defense.
financial_constraints: Applicants must provide a realistic budget, justifying the necessity of requested funds for personnel, material costs, investments in equipment or databases, knowledge utilization, and (inter)national collaboration.
eligible_costs: Personnel costs, material budgets, investments in equipment or databases, knowledge utilization, and (inter)national collaboration.
call_document: doc/CfP SGW Open Competitie M 2024 EN_v09 2024.pdf

title: NWO Open Competition Domain Science-M (2025-2026)
submission_period: Expected to open in August 2025; specific deadlines to be announced. The information below is based on the details from the last round and may be subject to changes in the upcoming call.
funding_amount: Details to be confirmed; previous rounds offered up to €800,000 per project.
domains: Exact and Natural Sciences (ENW), including earth sciences, astronomy, chemistry, computer science, life sciences, physics, and mathematics.
eligibility: Researchers with tenured or tenure-track positions at Dutch universities, university medical centers, and recognized research institutes.
restrictions: Applicants may submit only one ENW-M proposal for substantive consideration every twelve months.
unique_conditions: The upcoming round may introduce changes to investment application processes; details will be provided in the official call.
financial_constraints: Specifics to be announced; previous rounds required a realistic budget with justified spending choices.
eligible_costs: Typically includes personnel, material costs, small investments (equipment), and non-scientific support; exact details to be confirmed.
call_document: To be published upon official announcement.

title: NWO SSH Open Competition M 2026
submission_period: Expected to open in June 2026; specific deadlines to be announced. The information below is based on the details from the last round and may be subject to changes in the upcoming call.
funding_amount: Up to €400,000 per project, based on previous rounds.
domains: Social Sciences and Humanities (SSH), including disciplines such as sociology, psychology, economics, history, and cultural studies.
eligibility: Researchers who obtained their PhD at least ten years prior to the application deadline, holding a salaried position at a Dutch knowledge institution.
restrictions: Applicants with an ongoing SSH Open Competition project may only submit a proposal if the planned end date of the current project is within one year of the deadline of this call.
unique_conditions: Each application may include one co-applicant, without restrictions on the number of years since their PhD defense.
financial_constraints: Applicants must provide a realistic budget, justifying the necessity of requested funds for personnel, material costs, investments in equipment or databases, knowledge utilization, and (inter)national collaboration.
eligible_costs: Personnel costs, material budgets, investments in equipment or databases, knowledge utilization, and (inter)national collaboration.
call_document: To be published upon official announcement.

title: NWO SSH Open Competition XS 2025 - Round 1
eligibility: Researchers with a PhD obtained between 7 March 2015 and 6 March 2020. Applicants must hold a paid appointment at a recognized institution for the duration of the application process and the project.
restrictions: Each applicant may submit only one application for the SSH-XS call in 2025 and must not be part of an ongoing XS project at the time of submission.
unique_conditions: Applications must be anonymized, with no names, affiliations, or self-references included. Submission is via the ISAAC system.
financial_constraints: No specific financial constraints mentioned beyond the funding cap per project (€50,000).
eligible_costs: No explicit details provided but expected to include personnel, consumables, and other project-related expenses within the funding cap. (XS)

eligibility: Researchers with a PhD obtained between 7 March 2015 and 6 March 2020. Applicants must hold a paid appointment at a recognized institution for the duration of the application process and the project.
restrictions: Each applicant may submit only one application for the SSH-XS call in 2025 and must not be part of an ongoing XS project at the time of submission.

financial_constraints: No specific financial constraints mentioned beyond the funding cap per project (€50,000).
eligible_costs: No explicit details provided but expected to include personnel, consumables, and other project-related expenses within the funding cap.

restrictions: Each applicant may submit only one application for the SSH-XS call in 2025 and must not be part of an ongoing XS project at the time of submission.

title: NWO Open Competition Domain Science XS 2024 - Package 24-1
domains: Exact and Natural Sciences (ENW), including life sciences, physical sciences, and exact sciences.
eligibility: Researchers with a salaried position for at least the duration of the project and the application process at eligible Dutch institutions, such as universities, university medical centers, and recognized research institutes.
restrictions: Each applicant can only submit one proposal per package. Applicants who submitted a proposal in the immediately preceding package or the final package of 2023 may not apply.
unique_conditions: Proposals must be anonymous, avoiding any names, affiliations, or references to prior work by the applicant. All applicants are required to assess other proposals in their cluster.
financial_constraints: No specific constraints beyond the €50,000 funding limit. Applicants must provide a realistic budget and justify spending choices.
eligible_costs: Personnel, material costs, citizen science activities, travel expenses, and data management costs. Basic amenities such as laptops or office furniture are excluded.

eligible_costs: Personnel, material costs, citizen science activities, travel expenses, and data management costs. Basic amenities such as laptops or office furniture are excluded.

title: NWO Talent Programme Veni 2024 (SSH Domain)
submission_period: Pre-proposals: 3 September 2024, before 14:00:00 CEST. Full proposals: 28 January 2025, before 14:00:00 CET.
domains: Social Sciences and Humanities (SSH), including Cultural Sciences, Economics, Philosophy, Education, Law, Public Administration, and Social Sciences.
eligibility: Researchers who obtained their PhD between 1 January 2021 and 3 September 2024, or later with a valid extension for career-dependent circumstances.
restrictions: Applicants may submit a maximum of one Veni application in the 2024 round and no more than twice in their career.
unique_conditions: Pre-proposals are mandatory. Applications must include an embedding guarantee from the host institution.
financial_constraints: Maximum budget of €320,000. Research duration is up to 3 years, extendable proportionally for part-time research to a maximum of 4 years.
eligible_costs: Personnel, material costs, and other necessary research expenses.

title: NWO Talent Programme Veni 2024 (Science Domain)
submission_period: Pre-proposals: 3 September 2024, before 14:00:00 CEST. Full proposals: 28 January 2025, before 14:00:00 CET.
domains: Science, including Earth Sciences, Astronomy, Life Sciences, Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics, and Computer Science.
eligibility: Researchers who obtained their PhD between 1 January 2021 and 3 September 2024, or later with a valid extension for career-dependent circumstances.
restrictions: Applicants may submit a maximum of one Veni application in the 2024 round and no more than twice in their career.
unique_conditions: Pre-proposals are mandatory. Applications must include an embedding guarantee from the host institution.
financial_constraints: Maximum budget of €320,000. Research duration is up to 3 years, extendable proportionally for part-time research to a maximum of 4 years.
eligible_costs: Personnel, material costs, and other necessary research expenses.

title: European Research Council (ERC) Starting Grant 2025
funding_amount: Up to €1.5 million for a period of 5 years; an additional €1 million may be requested for specific eligible costs.
domains: All fields of research are eligible; the ERC operates on a 'bottom-up' basis without predetermined priorities.
eligibility: Researchers of any nationality with 2-7 years of experience since completion of PhD, a scientific track record showing great promise, and an excellent research proposal.
restrictions: Applicants may submit only one ERC grant application per call and cannot hold more than one ERC grant at a time.
unique_conditions: Research must be conducted in a public or private research organization (host institution) located in an EU Member State or Associated Country. The Principal Investigator does not need to be employed by the host institution at the time of proposal submission but must have a mutual agreement if the proposal is successful.
financial_constraints: The grant covers up to 100% of the total eligible direct costs plus a 25% contribution towards indirect costs.
eligible_costs: Personnel, equipment, consumables, travel, and other necessary expenses for the research project.

title: European Research Council (ERC) Consolidator Grant 2025
funding_amount: Up to €2 million for a period of 5 years; an additional €1 million may be requested for specific eligible costs.
domains: All fields of research are eligible; the ERC operates on a 'bottom-up' basis without predetermined priorities.
eligibility: Researchers of any nationality with 7-12 years of experience since completion of PhD (i.e., PhD awarded between 1 January 2013 and 31 December 2017), a scientific track record showing great promise, and an excellent research proposal.
restrictions: Applicants may submit only one ERC grant application per call and cannot hold more than one ERC grant at a time.
unique_conditions: Research must be conducted in a public or private research organization (host institution) located in an EU Member State or Associated Country. The Principal Investigator does not need to be employed by the host institution at the time of proposal submission but must have a mutual agreement if the proposal is successful.
financial_constraints: The grant covers up to 100% of the total eligible direct costs plus a 25% contribution towards indirect costs.
eligible_costs: Personnel, equipment, consumables, travel, and other necessary expenses for the research project.

title: Boosting Fact-Checking Activities in Europe
submission_period: Open call until 28 February 2025, with funding rounds in February, June, and October.
funding_amount: Up to €55,000 for urgent actions (up to 6 months); up to €80,000 for scale-up projects (up to 12 months).
eligibility: Independent fact-checking organizations and consortia located in the EU, EFTA, and UK. Collaborations with Ukrainian fact-checking and media organizations are eligible for subcontracting costs.
restrictions: Ukrainian organizations are not eligible as funded partners but can participate through subcontracting.
unique_conditions: Projects should aim to increase the coverage, depth, and speed of fact-checking activities, especially in connection to critical events or to improve detection of disinformation narratives.
financial_constraints: Funding is allocated per project type and must adhere to the specified maximum amounts.
eligible_costs: Personnel, technology acquisition, freelance collaborations, and other expenses related to enhancing fact-checking capabilities.
